newsitem.title: UK: Guatemala could have more 5 pct sugar cane in 96/9.
newsitem.headline: Guatemala could have more 5 pct sugar cane in 96/9.

text.p: Guatemala's sugar harvest could benefit from around five percent more cane in 1997/98 and build on last season's record availability, Czarnikow Sugar said in a report on Thursday.

"The sugar industry in Guatemala seems set to continue its trend of growth and already there are predictions that the amount of cane available for harvest next season could rise by some five percent over the record levels achieved this season," it said.

Czarnikow said growers in Guatemala had found cane an attractive crop with good returns. They also received finance benefits through the mills and the area planted to cane had steadily risen during the past 25 years.
This season's cane area totalled 175,000 hectares, it said.

In its latest revisions to 1996/97 sugar production forecasts, published in May, Czarnikow pegged Guatemalan output at 1.53 million tonnes raw value. Guatemala produced 1.41 million tonnes of sugar in 1995/96.
